title: Calories in a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in grilled cheese sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations under 400 kcal.
h1: Calories in a Grilled Cheese Sandwich
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 slices American cheese, 1 tbsp butter per side for grilling; standard size.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, cheese brand, butter amount, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A classic grilled cheese sandwich has about 350 kcal with 15 g protein and 20 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Add 1 slice tomato and reduce butter to ½ tbsp
Use low-fat cheese and no butter (dry grill)

faqs.q: How many calories in grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard version with white bread and American cheese.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: About 15 g protein, mostly from the cheese.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in grilled cheese?
faqs.a: Yes—whole wheat can reduce calories by 20 kcal compared to white bread.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 20 g total fat, with 10 g saturated from cheese and butter.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie grilled cheese sandwich?
faqs.a: Opt for low-fat cheese, less butter, or add veggies like tomato to cut up to 100 kcal.
